comments: Number of Euclidean spaces for every compact Riemannian n-manifold to be realizable as a sub-manifold.
references: John Nash, The Imbedding Problem For Riemannian Manifolds, Annals of Mathematics, Vol. 63, No. 1, 1956, pp. 20-63.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000
formula: a(n) = Sum_{j=4..n} (n+j-1). - _Zerinvary Lajos_, Sep 12 2006a(n) = 3*n + a(n-1) + 4 (with a(0)=0). - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Aug 07 2010G.f.: x*(7 - 4*x)/(1 - x)^3. - _Arkadiusz Wesolowski_, Dec 24 2011
mathematica: s=0;lst={s};Do[s+=n++ +7;AppendTo[lst, s], {n, 0, 6!, 3}];lst (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Nov 16 2008 *)Table[Sum[i + n - 3, {i, 5, n}], {n, 4, 52}] (* _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jul 11 2009 *)
crossrefs: The generalized pentagonal numbers b*n + 3*n*(n-1)/2, for b = 1 through 12, form sequences A000326, A005449, A045943, A115067, A140090, A140091, A059845, A140672, A140673, A140674, A140675, A151542.
author: Jason Earls (zevi_35711(AT)yahoo.com), Mar 10 2001
